intro: Nasturtium proliferum, commonly known as the spreading nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant is a member of the Tropaeolaceae family and is known for its edible flowers and leaves, which have a peppery taste. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Nasturtium proliferum is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators and repel certain garden pests.
